title: feat: return version of the mock server via FFI
body:
Adds a `*char version()` c interface to the mock server FFI, for use with detecting compatible client versions.

NOTE: I originally added it as a `*const  c_char` but it then required freeing via the usual c call. I think this consistency is nicer.

title: WIP: Feat/pacts for verification
body:
This PR adds the following new features:

1. Adds a new Pact Source to enable pact verification using the new "pacts for verification" endpoint (https://github.com/pact-foundation/pact_broker/issues/307)
1. Pending pacts, WIP pacts and tags are now supported
1. Updates the provider CLI with new these (and other) options (currently does not allow users to specific "selectors" via the CLI, this would be easily achieved after this PR is sorted), which uses the new source
1. Adds basic environment variable support to the verifier to match the existing one

**General comments:**
* The code is still WIP and there are TODOs/Cleanups that need to happen (including moving to that streaming API where it makes sense). It does work though 👍 
* I'd specifically created a new `PactSource` because I wasn't aware of any backwards compatibility issues by changing it. If we don't need that because the only public interface is the CLI, then I'll replace the old implementation instead
* To pass the pending/verification notices to the actual verifier, I've threaded an optional `PactVerificationContext` which contains the notices alongside the Pacts and Pact source through the same process. As there are a few layers in which this passes, it's had an unfortunately side-effect of requiring a lot of functions to change. This probably also needs to be considered for backwards compatibility 
* There are a few places where duplication started appearing as a result of this (e.g. the CLI Main), I'll clean that up

If you have better/other ideas that I could try here, let me know (I considered a number of options, but they didn't feel right).

**Areas I'd like some specific feedback/assistance on:**

* Use of serde_json to serialise/deserialise the payloads. Dealing with the raw `serde_json::Value` was making this code very unreadable. Moving to to `serde_json::to_string` (and `from_value`) made this a lot nicer. Is there a reason this approach wasn't taken elsewhere?
* Where to put things. The pact_broker.rs file is getting pretty big. Currently, I've just dumped some types in there along side the new implementation to fetch pacts. Let me know if you'd like it moved
* Test approach: should we create a Pact test for this? :) Any other pointers? I've tried following previous 
* Code formatting: my editor badly wants to try and reformat the code, but doing so would have made this PR unreadable. How do you do this now?

title: Set content-type header in message request to provider
body:
This is a minor change that sets the `Content-Type` http header to `application-json` when sending POST requests to the provider to run the verification process against its messages.

The lack of that header caused some (albeit minor) annoyances in one of our projects, as the library we used to expose the verification endpoint would not automatically parse the body of the request when the header is missing.

I found no tests relevant to this behavior, therefore I only tested this change manually. Please let me know if I missed anything.

Also, I haven't found any guidelines for contributing, so in case I did anything wrong please let me know :)
Thanks!

title: Add MessagePact (Pact with Messages instead of Interactions)
body:
This adds an initial implementation of a Message Pact from the v3 spec.
MITRE plans to use this in the near future via FFI to support a basic Pact provider testing capability for message-based services written in C++.

This implementation is missing `merge()`.
Since `merge()` is missing, no method is provided to write a MessagePact to disk and attempt to merge it.
Instead, `overwrite_pact()` is included, which just overwrites a file if it is present.
An additional `merge_pact()` method could be added later.

title: WIP add function to retrieve the CA cert for trusting
fix: write_pact_file  always serialising a v3 pacts
body: Writes the pact with the current Pact version, instead of hard coding to V3.

title: Teach Travis CI to cache Cargo dependencies
body:
Currently, Travis CI is slowed down by needing to re-process dependencies every time it runs. Per the [Travis documentation](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/languages/rust/#dependency-management), adding `cache: cargo` to the `.travis.yml` file will reuse dependencies and should speed up CI runs.

title: Avoid deprecated Error::description in favor of Display trait
body:
`Error::description` is deprecated as of Rust 1.42:
https://blog.rust-lang.org/2020/03/12/Rust-1.42.html#error:description-is-deprecated

title: Fix v3 Message Provider States
body:
The v3 spec moves from `providerState` to `providerStates`, but the `Message` implementation in the Rust reference uses the old version. This fixes that, fixes broken documentation links, updates tests to the corrected API, and attempts to at least partially correct the broken auto-derived `Serialize` and `Deserialize` impls (see commit description on that commit for more info).

title: Fix RequestFilterExecutor w/ verify_provider
body:
This fixes a compilation failure in `pact_verifier_cli` due to a typechecking issue with a `None` variant of an `Option<F> where F: RequestFilterExecutor` by introducing a `NullRequestFilterExecutor` and annotating the `None` variant to have the type `Option<Box<NullRequestFilterExecutor>>`. This allows the crate to compile as expected, and does not change behavior.

Note that if `NullRequestFilterExecutor` is ever attempted to be called (unlike the current usage, where it is solely used as a type annotation) it will panic the current thread.

title: Make pact_verifier_cli actually runnable by using tokio::main
body: I [commented](https://github.com/pact-foundation/pact-reference/pull/55#issuecomment-575983245) on the `pact_verifier_cli` problem you found. You're right, I had not actually tested running that executable. Here's what I believe is the fix. I have no deep explanation of how the fix works, it's just the first thing I thought of, and it seems to work.

title: Async/await
body:
~~Note that this PR should await a new major stable `reqwest` release before being merged. It should not be long. But I'm creating the PR anyway so that the essential parts can be reviewed.~~

The PR is now ready.

Lib upgrades:
* Requires Rust 1.39.0 for async/await syntax
* Upgrades tokio to 0.2
* Upgrades hyper to 0.13
* Upgrades reqwest to 0.10

API breaking changes:
~~`pact_consumer`: `trait StartMockServer` + `trait ValidatingMockServer`.~~

~~I've tried my best to make consumer tests work nicely with the recently released `tokio-0.2`. As the mock server itself is implemented asynchronously, I feel that it's correct to publicly expose its async interface, and make it compatible with the `[tokio::test]` macro. An publicly asynchronous mock server needs to be shut down explicitly, which I tried to make clear in the docs.~~

Removed `StartMockServer::create_mock_server`

There is no longer any support for starting the `pact_consumer` mock server asynchronously. This idea of mine was flawed. It's now instead always run in a separate thread. Implementation inspired by https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/blob/master/tests/support/server.rs.

This is good because it makes that API completely tokio-independent (no `async` functions exposed).

Fixes #51

title: Update to Rust 2018 edition
body:
The Rust 2018 edition removes the need to specify `extern crate`, and supports scoped macros, which I tend to like, especially for log statements: `log::info!(...)`. Also, the macro imports can be declared closer to the code that uses the macros (instead of a `macro_use` at the crate root), increasing code readability.

Some upgrades here and there (`log` needs to be at version 0.4 for scoped macro usage).

Fixes #52

title: Allow to recreate mock-server
body: It is currently not possible to create a mock server several times as the global logger will be initialize more than once.

title: Fix pack_mock_server C api and usage
body:
This PR remove the "_ffi" suffix from `create_mock_server` that seems to be readd.
This PR also fix broken usage (javascript and c examples).

title: Allow for listening on arbitrary IP address
body: Currently Rust reference library only allows for listening on 0.0.0.0 (Any). PactNet allows for listening on 0.0.0.0 (Any) and 127.0.0.1 (Localhost), but there's no technical reason to not allow listening on specific interface, and possibly on IPv6 addresses too. So I extended for listening on arbitrary IP addresses.
